name: Video Game Design, and Science & Technology Summer Camps
blurb: Main Campus Camps hosts summer camps that teach kids about video game design, science, technology, engineering, art and math.

rewards.reward: Every dollar helps, and to thank you for your pledge we will list your name on the MainCampus.Org website "Thank You" page. Plus, you'll have access to see updates about the camp project.
At this pledge level, we'll send you a digital copy of one of the games made at camp this summer. Plus, you'll also have your name listed on the MainCampus.Org "Thank You" page.

The Cat Rescue - what a fun reward! At last year's camp, 9-year old game maker, Laura Fleming, made a game which is currently on display at the Smithsonian Institute's Math Alive! exhibit, in Washington, DC (and will eventually travel around the world visiting 15 museums). With this pledge you'll receive a digital copy of Laura's game, 'The Cat Rescue' and a copy of one additional game from the 2012 summer camp. Plus, you'll also have your name listed on the MainCampus.Org "Thank You" page.

Show off your Kickstarter pride. With this pledge you'll receive a limited edition Main Campus "Kick Started" t-shirt, a digital copy of "The Cat Rescue", a copy of one additional game made in from the 2012 summer camp, and have your name listed as a "Gold Supporter" on the MainCampus.org website.

Here's a totally awesome reward: When you pledge $100 or more, we'll provide you with a free VIDEOGAME.NET email address, hosted on Google's GMAIL system (i.e. yourname@videogame.net). Your name will also be listed as a "Gold Supporter" on the MainCampus.org website, and you will receive the promotional items from the 'Kickstarter Pride' $50 reward.  PLUS, we'll send you digital copies of 5 video games that were made during the summer camp.

Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Math Supporter - You'll get everything offered in 'The Totally Awesome' $100 reward. You'll also get 5 additional video games that were made during summer camp (10 total). PLUS, we'll send you a Sci-Tec Quest experiment kit (we'll send you the kit and you, and/or your kids, build it).

Send a message to the next generation! At this level we will name one of our camp computers after you - we will add a 'nameplate' to the computer and include your name, and a message of inspiration from you to the campers.

In addition, you'll be listed as a "Gold Elite Supporter" on the MainCampus.org website, receive our promotional items form 'The Totally Awesome' $100 reward, and we'll send you two Sci-Tec Quest experiment kits (we'll send you the kits and you, and/or your kids, build them).

One last thing - at any pledges at (or above) $400, I'd like to meet you in person. That's right, the next time you and I are attending the same trade show (GDC, E3, or CES) at the same, we'll get together and meet over coffee.

You're Amazing Pledge - At this level our staff will with work with the 2012 campers to produce a web-based, multi-room, platform video game that features your likeness (in 16-bit cartoon style). After the game is developed, you'll give the game its official title, and it will be published on the camp's website. In addition, you'll also receive our promotional items from the 'Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Math' $200 reward.

Super Hero Pledge - This pledge will help Main Campus in ways that are beyond words. In addition to helping us get the camp off the ground, you, and/or your organization, will be invited to attend camp for a day (in person, or via Skype). You'll either provide a presentation to the camp, or introduce a guest speaker. You will also be listed as an "Ultimate Platinum Elite Supporter" on the MainCampus.org website, and you'll receive our promotional items form the 'Next Generation Message' $400 reward. Your pledge will also come with two plaques that designates you as a "Main Campus Hero" (one for you, and one for us to display in our camp).
